newsitem.title: FRANCE: Elyo sees 20-30 pct profit rise in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Elyo sees 20-30 pct profit rise in 1997.

text.p: Lyonnaise des Eaux unit Elyo expects a rise of more than 20 percent, and perhaps even 30 percent, in 1997 net attributable profit, Elyo chairman Michel Bleitrach said on Monday.
"We're counting on a significant advance, of more than 20 percent and possibly 30 percent in consolidated net attributable profit," he told Reuters ahead of a 1996 results presentation.
One of the main driving factors was the completion of restructuring, he said.

The group said on March 13 it made a net attributable profit of 73 million francs in 1996 after a loss of 229 million francs the preceding year. The 1996 results included a large drop in exceptional charges to 115 million francs from 363 million.
